lexicon.brief: an abominable thing, an accursed thing
lexicon.long: an abominable thing, an accursed thing.
I abhor, detest, loathe.
I commit adultery (of a man with a married woman, but also of a married man).
I commit adultery, not only of a married woman but of a married man.
(a) an adulteress (that is, a married woman who commits adultery), (b) Hebraistically: extended to those who worship any other than the true God.
adultery.
an adulterer, that is, a man who is guilty with a married woman.
an altar (for sacrifice).
an altar, platform; a slightly-elevated spot.

lexicon.brief: verily, truly, amen, so let it be
lexicon.long: verily, truly, amen; at the end of sentences may be paraphrased by: So let it be.
a messenger, generally a (supernatural) messenger from God, an angel, conveying news or behests from God to men.
equal to or like the angels.

lexicon.brief: a ruler of angels, a superior angel, an archangel
lexicon.long: a ruler of angels, a superior angel, an archangel.
I anoint: festivally, in homage, medicinally, or in anointing the dead.
I anoint.
I anoint, consecrate by anointing.
I spread on, anoint.
an anointing.
I rub in, anoint.

lexicon.brief: an apostle, a messenger, an envoy, a delegate
lexicon.long: a messenger, envoy, delegate, one commissioned by another to represent him in some way, especially a man sent out by Jesus Christ Himself to preach the Gospel; an apostle.
commission, duty of apostle, apostleship.
(a) I assign, arrange, (b) I determine; mid: I appoint.
I set down, bring down to a place; I set in order, appoint, make, constitute.
I put, place, lay, set, fix, establish.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause.
I lie, recline, am placed, am laid, set, specially appointed, destined.

lexicon.brief: I show forth, show clearly, proclaim, appoint
lexicon.long: I show forth, show clearly; hence: I proclaim (a person's appointment to an office), appoint.
(a) I appoint, make (of a covenant), (b) I make (a will).
I appoint, choose, elect, take into hand.
(a) I instruct, command, (b) I appoint, assign.
I separate, mark off by boundaries; I determine, appoint, designate.
appointed before; a previously-appointed time.
(properly: a wooden box, hence) the Ark, in which Noah sailed; the Ark of the Covenant.
(a) power, authority, weight, especially: moral authority, influence, (b) in a quasi-personal sense, derived from later Judaism, of a spiritual power, and hence of an earthly power.
I have (exercise) power (authority) over.
I exercise (wield) power (authority), pass: I am ruled, am held under authority.
(lit: a man who rules by force), a ruler, potentate; also: courtier, member of the court.
superiority, excellence, preeminence, authority.
I domineer, govern, have mastery over.
instruction, command, order, authority.
(a) abstr: lordship, (b) concr: divine or angelic lordship, domination, dignity, usually with reference to a celestial hierarchy.
lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.

lexicon.brief: the rite or ceremony of baptism
lexicon.long: the rite or ceremony of baptism.
the baptizer, the Baptist, epithet used only of John, the son of Zechariah and Elizabeth, forerunner of Jesus.
dipping, washing (of a ceremonial character).
I believe, have faith in, trust in; pass: I am entrusted with.
unbelief, unfaithfulness, distrust.
unbelieving, incredulous, unchristian; sometimes subst: unbeliever.
trustworthy, faithful, believing.
faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

loved, beloved, with two special applications: the Beloved, a title of the Messiah (Christ), as beloved beyond all others by the God who sent Him; of Christians, as beloved by God, Christ, and one another.
I love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem.
I speak evil against, blaspheme, use abusive or scurrilous language about (God or men).
abusive or scurrilous language, blasphemy.
slanderous; subst: a blasphemer.
happy, blessed, to be envied.
(lit: I speak well of) I bless; pass: I am blessed.
(a) I make straight, (b) met: I put in the right way, direct.
(used only of God), blessed (as entitled to receive blessing from man), worthy of praise.
I bless, pronounce blessed or happy.
I bless (of God).

lexicon.brief: regarding as happy, blessed, or enviable
lexicon.long: regarding as happy, blessed, or enviable.
adulation, praise, blessing, gift.

lexicon.brief: regarding as happy, blessed, or enviable
lexicon.long: regarding as happy, blessed, or enviable.
blood (especially as shed).
body, flesh; the body of the Church.
a fall; a carcass, corpse, dead body.
bodily, corporeal.
I obey one in authority, conform to advice, obey, follow.
(a) I hold fast, bind, arrest, (b) I take possession of, lay hold of, (c) I hold back, detain, restrain, (d) I hold a ship, keep its head.
belonging to the same body; fig: of Jews and Gentiles belonging to the same Church.
a limb, member of a body; fig: a corpse, carcass.
I hand over, pledge, hand down, deliver, commit, commend, betray, abandon.
I bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful.
I bind, put in chains, tie together.
I owe, ought.
a bond, chain, imprisonment; a string or ligament, an impediment, infirmity.

I bind (tie) around.
that which binds together; a band, bond.
I curse, invoke curses, devote to destruction.
I lie about, surround; I am encompassed, surrounded, or clothed with, am in submission to.
slavery, bondage.
I enclose, shut in, make subject to.
I enslave.
one bound, a prisoner.
I bind together; pass: I am bound together with, as of prisoners in chains.
I spare, abstain, forbear.
a new birth, regeneration, renewal.

lexicon.brief: I beget, bring forth, give birth to
lexicon.long: I beget (of the male), (of the female) I bring forth, give birth to.
a new birth, regeneration, renewal.

lexicon.brief: I beget again, beget into a new life
lexicon.long: I beget again, beget into a new life.
a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.
brotherhood (in the collective sense), the members of the Christian Church, Christendom.
(denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
(a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name.
I call to myself, summon.

lexicon.brief: I call by an additional name, appeal to
lexicon.long: (a) I call (name) by a supplementary (additional, alternative) name, (b) mid: I call upon, appeal to, address.
I call to, summon; I call (out) to, address, give a speech to, harangue.
I give forth a sound, hence: (a) of a cock: I crow, (b) of men: I shout, (c) trans: I call (to myself), summon; I invite, address.
called, invited, summoned by God to an office or to salvation.
I call together.

lexicon.brief: I call, choose for myself, am named
lexicon.long: I call; mid: I choose for myself; pass: I am named.
I send for, summon.
mid: I summon to myself, send for.

(originally: I transact business), (a) act. of God: I warn; pass: I am warned by God (probably in response to an inquiry as to one's duty), (b) (I take a name from my public business, hence) I receive a name, am publicly called.

lexicon.brief: I give a name to, mention
lexicon.long: I give a name to, mention, call upon the name of.
(a) I send for, summon, invite, (b) I beseech, entreat, beg, (c) I exhort, admonish, (d) I comfort, encourage, console.
a calling, invitation; in the NT, always of a divine call.
falsely named, under a false name.
a centurion of the Roman army.
a centurion of the Roman army.
a centurion, an officer commanding about a hundred infantry in the Roman army.
a little child, an infant, little one.
(a) a male child, boy, (b) a male slave, servant; thus: a servant of God, especially as a title of the Messiah, (c) a female child, girl.
a child, descendent, inhabitant.
unlearned, unenlightened; noun: an infant, child.
offspring, child, fruit.
(a) seed, commonly of cereals, (b) offspring, descendents.
from childhood, from early boyhood.
infant, babe, child in arms.
only, only-begotten; unique.
a little child.
offspring, family, race, nation, kind.
I am childlike, childish, infantile.
child bearing, the rearing of a family.
I bring up children, rear young.
anointed; the Messiah, the Christ.
Messiah, the Anointed One.
an assembly, congregation, church; the Church, the whole body of Christian believers.
clean, pure, unstained, either literally or ceremonially or spiritually; guiltless, innocent, upright.
I cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context.
unclean, impure.
I cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context.
cleansing, purifying, purification, literal, ceremonial, or moral; met: expiation.
I cleanse, purify, either ceremonially, actually, or morally.
I clean (cleanse) out, clean thoroughly.
a bath (of water, not the vessel), water for washing, washing.
I give orders (injunctions, instructions, commands).
an ordinance, injunction, command, law.
I command, order, direct, bid.
I snort (with the notion of coercion springing out of displeasure, anger, indignation, antagonism), express indignant displeasure with some one; I charge sternly.
I notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly.
I give orders to, prescribe, arrange.
(a) I rebuke, chide, admonish, (b) I warn.
an injunction, ordinance, precept.
I give a commission (instructions), order; I admonish, prohibit.
I arrange with, direct, appoint, prescribe, ordain.
I give order, command, charge.
a command, charge, injunction; a precept, rule of living.
ordaining, ordinance, disposition.
a thing spoken, (a) a word or saying of any kind, as command, report, promise, (b) a thing, matter, business.
a mandate, decree, edict.
I feel compassion, have pity on, am moved.
I pity, have compassion on.
pity, compassion, favor, grace, mercy.

lexicon.brief: I sympathize with, have compassion on
lexicon.long: I sympathize with, have compassion on.
compassionate, merciful.
sympathizing, compassionate.
I condemn, pass sentence upon.
I condemn, judge worthy of punishment.
(a) a judgment, a verdict; sometimes implying an adverse verdict, a condemnation, (b) a case at law, a lawsuit.
(a) I judge, whether in a law-court or privately: sometimes with cognate nouns emphasizing the notion of the verb, (b) I decide, I think (it) good.
judging, judgment, decision, sentence; generally: divine judgment; accusation.
punishment following condemnation, penal servitude, penalty.
condemnation, censure.
I condemn, blame.
(a) I consent fully, agree out and out, (b) I confess, admit, acknowledge (cf. the early Hellenistic sense of the middle: I acknowledge a debt), (c) I give thanks, praise.
(a) I promise, agree, (b) I confess, (c) I publicly declare, (d) a Hebraism, I praise, celebrate.
a profession, confession.
(a) a covenant between two parties, (b) (the ordinary, everyday sense [found a countless number of times in papyri]) a will, testament.
a cross.

I crucify together with.
I fasten to, applied to Christ's being fastened to the cross.
I impede, crucify (again).
I curse.
I curse, devote to destruction.

lexicon.brief: on the top, above, superior to
lexicon.long: (a) adv: on the top, above, (b) prep: on the top of, above, over, on, above, more than, superior to.
a votive offering, a thing devoted to God; a curse, the thing cursed.
cursing; a curse; meton: a doomed one.
on whom a curse has been invoked, accursed, doomed to destruction.
a curse, an accursed thing.
an evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity.
an evil-spirit, demon.
wind, breath, spirit.

a learner, disciple, pupil.

lexicon.long: I make a disciple of, train in discipleship; pass: I am trained, discipled, instructed.
a fellow disciple.
a female disciple, female Christian.

chosen out, elect, choice, select, sometimes as subst: of those chosen out by God for the rendering of special service to Him (of the Hebrew race, particular Hebrews, the Messiah, and the Christians).
I pick out for myself, choose, elect, select.

lexicon.brief: a choosing out, selecting, choice by God

fellow-elect, fellow-chosen.
age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.

lexicon.brief: an age, a cycle of time
lexicon.long: an age, a cycle (of time), especially of the present age as contrasted with the future age, and of one of a series of ages stretching to infinity.
eternal, everlasting.

lexicon.brief: a eunuch, keeper of the bed-chamber

evil, bad, wicked, malicious, slothful.

wickedness, iniquities.
bad, evil, in the widest sense.

worthless, wicked, base.
badly, evilly, wrongly.
the, the definite article.
I speak evil of, rail at, slander.
a transgression, violation of law.
doing evil; subst: an evil-doer.

high, lofty.

of little faith.

cowardly, timid, fearful.

greatly terrified, horrified.

fleshly, carnal, earthly.

unintelligent, without wisdom, unwise, undiscerning (implying probably moral defect).
want of sense, foolishness, impiety, wickedness.
senseless, foolish, inconsiderate.
foolish, thoughtless.

folly, absurdity, foolishness.
foolish talking.
folly, madness, foolishness.
(a) empty, (b) met: empty (in moral content), vain, ineffective, foolish, worthless, (c) false, unreal, pretentious, hollow.

lexicon.long: (a) I send away, (b) I let go, release, permit to depart, (c) I remit, forgive, (d) I permit, suffer.
a sending away, a letting go, a release, pardon, complete forgiveness.

lexicon.brief: I come into being, am born
lexicon.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.
I fill, fulfill, complete.
completion, fulfillment, perfection.

a completion, fulfillment, accomplishment.

(a) a fill, fullness; full complement; supply, patch, supplement, (b) fullness, filling, fulfillment, completion.

a female Greek.
foreign, of another tribe or race.
in the manner of Gentiles, like the rest of the world.
a gift, present.
a gift, present.

a gift of grace, an undeserved favor.
a gift, bounty.
a giving, gift, donation.
honor, renown; glory, an especially divine quality, the unspoken manifestation of God, splendor.

highly esteemed, splendid, glorious.

(a) God, (b) a god, generally.
devout, pious, God-fearing.
fighting against God.
deity, Godhead.
God-breathed, inspired by God, due to the inspiration of God.
father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior.
beautiful, as an outward sign of the inward good, noble, honorable character; good, worthy, honorable, noble, and seen to be so.
intrinsically good, good in nature, good whether it be seen to be so or not, the widest and most colorless of all words with this meaning.
well, nobly, honorably, rightly.
well, well done, good, rightly; also used as an exclamation.

lexicon.brief: I do that which is good

goodness, uprightness, kindness, gentleness.

(a) good-will (good-pleasure), favor, feeling of complacency of God to man, (b) good-pleasure, satisfaction, happiness, delight of men.

loving what is good.
good-doing, doing of good.
shining, magnificent, bright, splendid.

the good news of the coming of the Messiah, the gospel; the gen. after it expresses sometimes the giver (God), sometimes the subject (the Messiah, etc.), sometimes the human transmitter (an apostle).

lexicon.brief: I bring good news, preach good tidings
lexicon.long: I bring good news, preach good tidings, with or without an object, expressing either the persons who receive the good news or the good news itself (the good news being sometimes expressed as a person).

lit: the heart; mind, character, inner self, will, intention, center.

the inward parts; the heart, affections, seat of the feelings.
heaven, (a) the visible heavens: the atmosphere, the sky, the starry heavens, (b) the spiritual heavens.
in heaven, belonging to heaven, heavenly, from heaven.
heavenly, celestial, in the heavenly sphere, the sphere of spiritual activities; met: divine, spiritual.
from heaven, from the sky.
mid-heaven, the middle of heaven, the zenith.
Gehenna, and originally the name of a valley or cavity near Jerusalem, a place underneath the earth, a place of punishment for evil.
high priest, chief priest.

set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred.
holiness, godliness, piety.
holy, pious, godly, beloved of God.
holiness, sanctity, as an abstract quality.

religiously, piously.

unholy, profane.
sacred, holy, set apart.

a price, honor.
(a) comely, seemly, decorous, (b) of honorable position (in society), wealthy, influential.
venerable, honorable, grave, serious, dignified.

of great price, precious, honored.

hope, expectation, trust, confidence.

humble, lowly, in position or spirit (in a good sense).

abasement (in spirit), low condition (in circumstances).
humility, lowliness of mind, modesty.

(lit: stage-playing), a response, answer, hypocrisy, dissembling.
I dissemble with, play a part with.
I inherit, obtain (possess) by inheritance, acquire.

an inheritance, an heritage, regularly the gift of God to His chosen people, in the Old Testament: the Promised Land, in NT a possession viewed in one sense as present, in another as future; a share, participation.
I give as an inheritance, distribute by lot.
(a) a lot, (b) a portion assigned; hence: a portion of the people of God assigned to one's care, a congregation.
(lit: unmixed) simple, unsophisticated, sincere, blameless.
guiltless, innocent.
(sometimes: unpunished), guiltless, innocent.
innocent, guileless, simple.
(originally, in a condition prepared for worship), pure (either ethically, or ritually, ceremonially), chaste.
(Hebrew), Israel, surname of Jacob, then the Jewish people, the people of God.
an Israelite, one of the chosen people of Israel, a Jew.
Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.
lord, master, sir; the Lord.
Jewish.
Judea, a Roman province, capital Jerusalem.
in the manner of Jews (religiously, ceremonially).
I live as a Jew (in religion, ceremonially).
Jewish, Judaic.
a judge.
I condemn, pass sentence upon.
answerable to, liable to (brought under) the judgment of.
distinguishing; hence: deciding, passing sentence on; the act of judgment, discernment.
opinion, counsel, judgment, intention, decree.
criterion; a law-court; a law-case before an arbiter; a cause, controversy.
I separate, distinguish, discern one thing from another; I doubt, hesitate, waver.
critical, able to judge or discern.

lexicon.brief: I make righteous, defend the cause of, justify

justly, righteously.

righteous, just.
acquittal, justifying, justification, a process of absolution.

kingship, sovereignty, authority, rule, especially of God, both in the world, and in the hearts of men; hence: kingdom, in the concrete sense.

usage, custom, law; in NT: of law in general, plur: of divine laws; of a force or influence impelling to action; of the Mosaic law; meton: of the books which contain the law, the Pentateuch, the Old Testament scriptures in general.

lexicon.brief: about law, one learned in the Law

(a) the vital breath, breath of life, (b) the human soul, (c) the soul as the seat of affections and will, (d) the self, (e) a human person, an individual.

life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence.
(a) life, (b) manner of life; livelihood.
belonging to ordinary life, worldly.
I make that which was dead to live, cause to live, quicken.
I live together with.

lexicon.brief: I rest, am silent, live quietly

master, teacher, chief, commander.
of the Lord, special to the Lord.

loving one's husband.

love of mankind, benevolence.
loving like a brother, loving one's brethren.
full of pity, merciful, compassionate.

pity, mercy, compassion.

propitious, forgiving, merciful.

a waiter, servant; then of any one who performs any service, an administrator.

waiting at table; in a wider sense: service, ministration.

a minister, servant, of an official character; of priests and Levites.
given to serving (ministration), ministering.
(a) physical power, force, might, ability, efficacy, energy, meaning (b) plur: powerful deeds, deeds showing (physical) power, marvelous works.
wonderful, admirable; subst: a wonder.
myrrh.
name, character, fame, reputation.
by name.

lexicon.brief: I name, impose a name on
lexicon.long: I name, impose a name on; pass: am named.
(a) a comparison, (b) a parable, often of those uttered by our Lord, (c) a proverb, an adage.
a cryptic saying, an allegory; a proverb, figurative discourse.

lexicon.brief: the feast of Passover, the Passover lamb
lexicon.long: the feast of Passover, the Passover lamb.
(a) I kill, destroy, (b) I lose, mid: I am perishing (the resultant death being viewed as certain).

lexicon.brief: I am dying, am about to die
lexicon.long: I am dying, am about to die, wither, decay.

lexicon.brief: I cause to disappear, I hide, remove, disfigure
lexicon.long: I cause to disappear, hide, remove; I disfigure (probably by leaving unwashed for a long period), destroy.
corruptible, perishable.
I perish along with.
a Pharisee, one of the Jewish sect so called.
(a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can.
(a) of persons: powerful, able, (b) of things: possible.
I am powerful, have power, am able, am mighty.
strength (absolutely), power, might, force, ability.
dominion, strength, power; a mighty deed.
I pray, pray for, offer prayer.
(a) prayer (to God), (b) a place for prayer (used by Jews, perhaps where there was no synagogue).
supplication, prayer, entreaty.
(a) I ask (a question), question, (b) I request, make a request to, pray.
I pray, wish.
(lit: approaching the king, hence a technical term), a petition, prayer, intercession.
a prayer comprising a vow; a prayer, vow.
a priest, one who offers sacrifice to a god (in Jewish and pagan religions; of Christians only met.).
the duty (office) of a priest, priesthood.
the abstract notion of the priestly office.

lexicon.brief: the act or office of priesthood
lexicon.long: the act or office of priesthood.
I promise, profess.
a promise.
I promise beforehand.
a promise.
a prophet, poet; a person gifted at expositing divine truth.
I foretell, prophesy; I set forth matter of divine teaching by special faculty.
prophecy, prophesying; the gift of communicating and enforcing revealed truth.
a prophetess.
prophetic, uttered by a prophet.
Rabbi, my master, teacher; a title of respect often applied to Christ.
Rabbi, my master, teacher; a title of respect often applied to Christ.

lexicon.brief: a ransom, an offering of expiation
lexicon.long: the purchasing money for manumitting slaves, a ransom, the price of ransoming; especially the sacrifice by which expiation is effected, an offering of expiation.

lexicon.brief: I become reconciled to, reconcile myself with
lexicon.long: I change, exchange; I reconcile, change enmity for friendship.
I change, exchange, reconcile.
reconciliation, restoration to favor.
I reconcile, change from one state of feeling to another.
I repent, change my mind, change the inner man (particularly with reference to acceptance of the will of God), repent.
repentance, a change of mind, change in the inner man.
(lit: I change one care or interest for another), I change my mind (generally for the better), repent, regret.
a rising again, resurrection.
a waking up, resurrection.
a rising up and out, resurrection.

lexicon.brief: I uncover, bring to light, reveal
lexicon.long: I uncover, bring to light, reveal.
apparent, clear, visible, manifest; adv: clearly.

lexicon.brief: I make clear, visible, or manifest
lexicon.long: I make clear (visible, manifest), make known.
an unveiling, uncovering, revealing, revelation.
(a) I reveal, make known (in a law court), I lay information, inform, (b) I make known, point out.
I show, make clear, reveal.
just; especially, just in the eyes of God; righteous; the elect (a Jewish idea).
(usually if not always in a Jewish atmosphere), justice, justness, righteousness, righteousness of which God is the source or author, but practically: a divine righteousness.
unjust, unrighteous, wicked.
injustice, unrighteousness, hurt.
straightness, uprightness.
I act unjustly towards, injure, harm.

lexicon.brief: on the right hand, right hand, right
lexicon.long: on the right hand, right hand, right.
the Sabbath, a week.
a keeping of the Sabbath, a Sabbath rest.
a Sadducee, a member of the aristocratic party among the Jews, from whom the high-priests were almost invariably chosen.
(adj. used often as a noun), slanderous; with the article: the Slanderer (par excellence), the Devil.
Satan.
demon-like, such as demons have.
I save, heal, preserve, rescue.
welfare, prosperity, deliverance, preservation, salvation, safety.
I rescue, deliver (from danger or destruction).
saving, bringing salvation; subst: salvation.
I save (rescue) through (some danger), bring safely to, escaped to.

lexicon.brief: a scribe, town-clerk, man of learning
lexicon.long: (a) in Jerusalem, a scribe, one learned in the Jewish Law, a religious teacher, (b) at Ephesus, the town-clerk, the secretary of the city, (c) a man of learning generally.

lexicon.brief: I rail off, separate, place apart
lexicon.long: I rail off, separate, place apart.
a sign, miracle, indication, mark, token.
a signal agreed upon.
a showing, proof, demonstration, sign, token.
(a thing proved, hence) a plain token (sign, proof).
prop: missing the mark; hence: (a) guilt, sin, (b) a fault, failure (in an ethical sense), sinful deed.
sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable.
originally: I miss the mark, hence (a) I make a mistake, (b) I sin, commit a sin (against God); sometimes the idea of sinning against a fellow-creature is present.
a fault, sin, evil deed.
I sin previously.
a son, descendent.
of one accord.
an apparition, ghost, spirit, phantom.
spiritual.
spiritually, in a spiritual way; from a spiritual point of view.
I stone, cast stones (at), kill by stoning.

lexicon.brief: I stone down, stone to death
lexicon.long: I stone down, stone to death, overwhelm with stones.
I stone, pelt with stones.
an assembly, congregation, synagogue, either the place or the people gathered together in the place.
a tent, booth, tabernacle, abode, dwelling, mansion, habitation.
a temple, either the whole building, or specifically the outer courts, open to worshippers.
a temple, a shrine, that part of the temple where God himself resides.
a temple for (containing) an image (an idol).
I try, tempt, test.
(a) trial, probation, testing, being tried, (b) temptation, (c) calamity, affliction.
a snare, stumbling-block, cause for error.
I saw, saw through.

lexicon.brief: I put to the test, make trial of, tempt
lexicon.long: I put to the test, make trial of, tempt, try.

lexicon.brief: I put to the test, prove, examine
lexicon.long: I put to the test, prove, examine; I distinguish by testing, approve after testing; I am fit.

lexicon.brief: I put to the test, prove, examine
lexicon.long: I put to the test, prove, examine; I distinguish by testing, approve after testing; I am fit.

lexicon.brief: a test, trial, what is genuine
lexicon.long: a test, trial, what is genuine.
witness, evidence, testimony, proof.
a witness; an eye- or ear-witness.
witness, evidence, testimony, reputation.
I give evidence (bear witness) against.
an eye-witness.

lexicon.brief: I give solemn evidence, testify solemnly
lexicon.long: I give solemn evidence, testify (declare) solemnly.
a witness; an eye- or ear-witness.

lexicon.brief: I call to witness, testify, solemnly charge
lexicon.long: (properly: I call (summon) to witness, and then absolutely) I testify, protest, asseverate; I conjure, solemnly charge.
I bear witness together with.
I unite in bearing witness, sanction.
I predict, testify or protest beforehand.

lexicon.brief: I am an eyewitness of, behold
lexicon.long: I am an eyewitness of, behold, look upon.
I testify earnestly, bear witness to.
a tetrarch, ruler over a fourth part of a region.

lexicon.brief: I rule over as a tetrarch
lexicon.long: I rule over as a tetrarch.
twelve; the usual way in which the Twelve apostles of Jesus are referred to.
eleven.
a falling away, lapse, slip, false step, trespass, sin.
truly, really, certainly, surely.
unconcealed, true, true in fact, worthy of credit, truthful.
truth, but not merely truth as spoken; truth of idea, reality, sincerity, truth in the moral sphere, divine truth revealed to man, straightforwardness.
true (lit: made of truth), real, genuine.
an untranslatable particle, generally answered by "de", each of the two introducing a clause intended to be contrasted with the other.

lexicon.brief: I say, speak truth, I do truth
lexicon.long: I say (speak) truth, do truth, maintain truth (the truth).
(lit: born in wedlock), hence: real, true, genuine; with definite article: the true, genuine element.
I persuade, urge.
unleavened, the paschal feast (a feast of the Hebrews); fig: uncorrupted, sincere.
intelligent, prudent, sensible, wise.
wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence.
wise, learned, cultivated, skilled, clever.
understanding (which leads to right action), practical wisdom, prudence.
wise, learned, cultivated, skilled, clever.
I make wise, instruct; pass: I am skillfully devised.
woe!, alas!, uttered in grief or denunciation.

lexicon.brief: a writing, passage of scripture, the scriptures
lexicon.long: (a) a writing, (b) a passage of scripture; plur: the scriptures.

lexicon.brief: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy
lexicon.long: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy.
a letter of the alphabet; collectively: written (revelation); (a) a written document, a letter, an epistle, (b) writings, literature, learning.
work, task, employment; a deed, action; that which is wrought or made, a work.
(a) a doing, action, mode of action; plur: deeds, acts, (b) function, business.
the world, universe; worldly affairs; the inhabitants of the world; adornment.
(properly: the land that is being inhabited, the land in a state of habitation), the inhabited world, that is, the Roman world, for all outside it was regarded as of no account.
the earth, soil, land, region, country, inhabitants of a region.
permitted to be trodden, accessible.
earthly, worldly (belonging to the present earthly world as opposed to the heavenly and future).
I go down on my knees to, do obeisance to, worship.
I reverence, worship, adore.
a worshipper.
an object of worship or veneration.
I serve, especially God, perhaps simply: I worship.
(underlying sense: reverence or worship of the gods), worship as expressed in ritual acts, religion.
service rendered to God, perhaps simply: worship.
worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable.
(a) considerable, sufficient, of number, quantity, time, (b) of persons: sufficiently strong (good, etc.), worthy, suitable, with various constructions, (c) many, much.

lexicon.brief: I account or treat as worthy
lexicon.long: I account or treat as worthy.
I deem (count) worthy.

lexicon.brief: worthily, in a manner worthy of
lexicon.long: worthily, in a manner worthy of.
anger, wrath, passion; punishment, vengeance.
an outburst of passion, wrath.
Zion, the hill; used for Jerusalem or heaven.
involved in, held in, hence: liable, generally with dat. (or gen.) of the punishment.

lexicon.brief: the cause of, the originator of
lexicon.long: the cause, author; the culprit, the accused; the crime.
a cause, reason, excuse; a charge, accusation; guilt; circumstances, case.
highest, most high, the heights.
blameless, free from fault or defect.

lexicon.brief: not offending, not causing offence, blameless
lexicon.long: (free from hurt or harm, hence) not offending, not causing offence, blameless.
irreproachable, blameless.
blameless, without blemish, unblemished, faultless.
blamelessly.
irreproachable, never caught doing wrong.
I cut around, circumcise.
circumcision.
(a technical word of Jewish use) foreskin, prepuce: used sometimes as a slang term by Jews, of Gentiles.
(lit: I draw over), mid: I become as uncircumcised.
a mutilation, spoiling.
a calling for, summons, hence: (a) exhortation, (b) entreaty, (c) encouragement, joy, gladness, (d) consolation, comfort.
I admonish, advise, exhort.

lexicon.brief: I dwell in, am settled in
lexicon.long: I dwell in, am settled (stationary) in; met: I am indwelling.
I am unfaithful, disbelieve, refuse belief, prove false.
I favor, bestow freely on.
(a) grace, as a gift or blessing brought to man by Jesus Christ, (b) favor, (c) gratitude, thanks, (d) a favor, kindness.
acceptable, accepted.
well-received, acceptable, welcome, pleasing.
I favor specially, show partiality.
full, abounding in, complete, completely occupied with.
(a) a house, the material building, (b) a household, family, lineage, nation.
a lamb, sheep.
a lamb (as a type of innocence, and with sacrificial connotation).
(originally: a little lamb, but diminutive force was lost), a lamb.
(divine) majesty or magnificence, glory.
(divine) majesty, greatness.
magnificent, superb, transcendent, majestic.
(ceremonial) purification.
(originally: unmixed), pure, uncontaminated, sincere.
purity, chastity.
cleanness, purity.
unadulterated, pure, guileless.
a maiden, virgin; extended to men who have not known women.
(in the Old Testament: ransoming from imprisonment for debt, or from slavery, release from national misfortune, etc.), liberation, deliverance, release.
release effected by payment of ransom; redemption, deliverance.
I release on receipt of ransom; mid: I redeem, release by paying ransom, liberate.
a redeemer, liberator, deliverer.
I buy out, buy away from, ransom; mid: I purchase out, buy, redeem, choose.
I buy.
a savior, deliverer, preserver.
one who is eagerly devoted to a person or a thing, a zealot.
(a) eagerness, zeal, enthusiasm, (b) jealousy, rivalry.
(a) speed, haste, (b) diligence, earnestness, enthusiasm.
(a) intrans: I am jealous, (b) trans: I am jealous of, with acc. of a person; I am eager for, am eager to possess, with acc. of a thing.
(a) intrans: I am jealous, (b) trans: I am jealous of, with acc. of a person; I am eager for, am eager to possess, with acc. of a thing.
a legal wrong, crime (with which one is charged), misdeed, crime against God, a sin.
intrans: I lament, wail; trans: I bewail.
beating of the breast or head in lamentation, lamentation.
(Hebrew), manna, the supernatural food eaten by the Israelites in the desert: of spiritual food.
a Christian.
the conscience, a persisting notion.
a custom, habit, practice.
brimstone, sulfur.
divinity, divine nature.
an oracle, divine response.
divine; subst: the Deity.

lexicon.brief: an evangelist, bearer of good tidings
lexicon.long: an evangelist, a missionary, bearer of good tidings.
an idol, false god.
a goddess.
a server (worshipper) of an image (an idol).

lexicon.brief: worship or service of an image
lexicon.long: service (worship) of an image (an idol).
(lit: partnership) (a) contributory help, participation, (b) sharing in, communion, (c) spiritual fellowship, a fellowship in the spirit.
I am a partaker with, have fellowship with, am an accomplice in.
piety (towards God), godliness, devotion, godliness.
impiety, irreverence, ungodliness, wickedness.
impious, ungodly, wicked.
reverence for God, fear of God, godliness, piety.
piously, religiously.
pious, God-fearing, devout.
a Hebrew, particularly one who speaks Hebrew (Aramaic).
the Hebrew language, or rather: Aramaic.

lexicon.brief: in the Hebrew or Aramaic dialect
lexicon.long: in the Hebrew, or rather, in the Aramaic dialect.
I make jealous, provoke to jealously, provoke to anger.
Pentecost, a feast of the Jews, the fiftieth day after Passover.
I foreordain, predetermine, mark out beforehand.
(a) an end, (b) event or issue, (c) the principal end, aim, purpose, (d) a tax.
left behind; the rest, the remainder.

lexicon.brief: I take up, receive, answer, suppose, welcome
lexicon.long: (a) I take up, (b) I welcome, entertain, (c) I answer, (d) I suppose, imagine.
a remnant, remainder.
restitution, reestablishment, restoration.

(a) I fit (join) together; met: I compact together, (b) act. and mid: I prepare, perfect, for his (its) full destination or use, bring into its proper condition (whether for the first time, or after a lapse).
adoption, as a son into the divine family.
a boaster, one who gives one's self airs in a loud and flaunting way.
the act of boasting, glorying, exultation.
a boasting; a ground of boasting (glorying, exultation).
I boast against, exult over.
I boast, vaunt myself.
vainglorious, boastful.
I dwell in, among.
with one's own hand.

lexicon.brief: I meet, encounter, call upon, make a petition
lexicon.long: (a) I meet, encounter, hence: (b) I call (upon), make a petition, make suit, supplication.
(a) a sin offering, by which the wrath of the deity shall be appeased; a means of propitiation, (b) the covering of the ark, which was sprinkled with the atoning blood on the Day of Atonement.
a propitiation (of an angry god), atoning sacrifice.
a transgression, overstepping, deviation.
a transgressor, law-breaker.
(a) trans: I lead forth; in the judicial sense, into court, (b) intrans. and trans: I precede, go before, (c) intrans: I go too far.
(a) I discipline, educate, train, (b) more severely: I chastise.
discipline; training and education of children, hence: instruction; chastisement, correction.
an instructor, trainer; almost: a chastiser.
a psalm, song of praise, the Hebrew book of Psalms.
I sing, sing psalms; earlier: I play on a stringed instrument.
ruler of all, ruler of the universe, the almighty.
an act of will, will; plur: wishes, desires.
in the corner (of a building); subst: corner-(stone).
a shepherd; hence met: of the feeder, protector, and ruler of a flock of men.
the birthright, the rights of the first-born.
(a) a people, characteristically of God's chosen people, first the Jews, then the Christians, (b) sometimes, but rarely, the people, the crowd.
antichrist, either one who puts himself in the place of, or the enemy (opponent) of the Messiah.
